title: Chefs &amp; farms
name: Chefs & farms
description:
A Map by Tanabutler

Featuring listings of chefs and restaurants who directly support local, sustainable agriculture. Brought to you by www.iheartfarms.com and photographer/writer Tana Butler (tanaATtanabutlerDOTcom). Includes farms, Slow Food members, purveyors of artisanal food products and more.

properties.name: 4th Street Bistro
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler3065 W 4th St, Reno, NVChef Natalie Sellera at 4th Street Bistro serves a seasonal menu that features organic vegetables and hormone-free meat. They feature a wonderful 100 bottle wine list with a nice selection of "boutique" wineries. Member of Chefs Collaborative. Reno Magazine\'s Top 101: "Best Soup" and "Best Piece of Meat." Entrees often include French, Moroccan, and Italian dishes. From Fodors.com: "You\'ll find deliciously simple, perfectly prepared cooking at this charming bistro, where the chef-owner uses organic produce and meats whenever possible. The casual white-tablecloth dining room, with its sponge-painted walls, is comfortable and inviting. Reservations essential." Phone (775)323-3200 Open for dinner, Tuesday through Saturday, 5:00PM

properties.name: Ammo
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler 1155 North Highland Ave., los angeles caAMMO sits in an unlikely spot on Highland Avenue in Hollywood and has become a local favorite of the community. At AMMO we let the seasons dictate what we prepare, always respecting the ingredients. We have worked hard building strong relations with local farmers and suppliers to ensure the freshest and best tasting ingredients possible. We also believe in purchasing organic when permitted. We have tried to create a compassionate and supportive environment for everyone working and dining at AMMO. We invite you to join us for Brunch, Lunch or Dinner.

properties.name: Border Grill
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler 1445 4th Street, santa monica caBorder Grill is the vibrant setting where Chefs Mary Sue Milliken and Susan Feniger, Food Network’s “Too Hot Tamales”, present the bold foods and flavors of Mexico. The Santa Monica-based restaurant serves upscale, modern Mexican food in a hip, urban cantina with decor as wild and bright as a fiesta. Border Grill has established a new standard for gourmet Mexican fare in Los Angeles and consistently ranks among the L.A. Times’ top restaurants. It has also been named “One of the Best Restaurants in America” by Gourmet.

properties.name: Boulette's Larder
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler  http://local.google.com/local?q=boulette%27s+larder,94111&hl=en&latlng=37797376,-122400147,33210886497398368251 Ferry Building San Francisco, CA 94111 The Larder is a restaurant dedicated to using ingredients which are seasonal and sustainably produced. We use pristeen ingredients delivered to us by bay area farmers as well as what we find at local farmers markets to create changing daily menus. We think of ourselves as an epicurean studio. We sell many of our ingredients and hope to inspire creativity in your own kitchen.

The daily-changing menu features creative dishes, using the freshest and finest ingredients available paired with carefully chosen California and European wines.

properties.name: Charlie Hong Kong
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler  1141 Soquel Avenue, Santa Cruz, CA, 95062Charlie Hong Kong 831-426-5664 1141 Soquel Avenue, Santa Cruz, Ca 95062 Charlie Hong Kong\'s business philosophy is to conduct its day to day business according to values that respect people, the environment, the community, and the larger global society. Our core values serve to guide the development of our policies, management style, and the day to day actions within and outside the business itself so that our impact on the planet is both bold yet gentle. In broad terms, these values are: Respect · Our actions show respect for each other, our customers, our community, and society. Integrity · We are honest in our dealings with each other, our customers, and our community . Accountability · As professionals, we are accountable for our actions and take responsibility for the safety of each other, our customers and the community . Fun · We believe the workplace should be a spiritually uplifting experience where joy and laughter are frequently found. Courage · To grow and to develop requires some risk-taking. We encourage each other to keep expanding our personal and professional boundaries.

properties.name: Claravale Farm
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler  Located on the south coast of Santa Cruz County, Claravale Farm has been in operation since 1927. We continue to use old-fashioned, time-honored dairying methods to provide you with fresh, high quality, natural, unprocessed milk and other dairy products. Claravale Farm is a small dairy, milking fewer than 50 cows. Our small size allows us to control every step of the process ourselves, and assures that you will receive the freshest, highest quality milk available.We welcome visitors to our farm -- please call first. Practices Followed on our Farm: * Humanely Raised * Organic (not Certified) Products offered by Claravale Farm: Dairy & Eggs * eggs * milk Farm Tourism & Events * Farm tours Meat Fish & Fowl * beef Specialty Products * artisan crafts * manure

properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler 40 Zils Rd, Watsonville, CASmall family farm open to the public with a beautiful view of Monterey Bay. We offer a farm stand, U-Pick berries, a pumpkin patch, and farm tours. We do farm tours all shapes and sizes, from pre-school to adults. We have twenty different varieties of winter squash and pumpkins.We offer U-Pick on our farm -- please contact us! We welcome visitors to our farm -- please call first. Practices Followed on our Farm: * Certified Organic Products offered by Crystal Bay Farm: Flowers * edible flowers * fresh flowers Fruits and Berries * apples * blackberries * raspberries * strawberries Herbs * fresh herbs Vegetables * pumpkins * winter squash

properties.name: DOPO
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler 4293 Piedmont Avenue, Oakland, CA, 94611DOPO 510-652-3676 An ingredient-focused Italian menu is the latest reason to venture into Oakland\'s gourmet ghetto.

properties.name: Delfina Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler  3621 18th Street, San Francisco, CA, 94110Delfina Restaurant 415-552-4055 Delfina is a bustling neighborhood trattoria in San Francisco\'s Mission District, owned by Anne and Craig Stoll. The food is Italian in spirit- simple, seasonal cooking which belies its depth of flavor. Modeled after small mom and pop restaurants found throughout Italy, the menu changes daily, driven by the offerings of local producers. The wine list, like the food, focuses exclusively on Italy and California. The setting and service both are imbued with the vibe of the restaurant\'s Mission neighborhood. Friendly, tattooed and incredibly knowledgeable, the servers have been recognized as "do(ing) their job better than many tuxedoed traditionalist." Delfina was awarded "Best Service" in San Francisco\'s 2003 reader\'s poll. As designed by Douglas Burnham of Envelope Architecture, the rich pallet of wrapping Jarrah hardwoods and zinc tables creates a warm, tactile space. Delfina is named after Ristorante Da Delfina in Artimino (Tuscany) where Craig worked in the winter of \'91.

properties.name: Dirty Girl Produce
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler   337 golf club dr., santa cruz, ca 95060337 Golf Club Dr. Santa Cruz, CA 95060 Joe Schirmer www.dirtygirlproduce.com/index.html 831-818-6516 We are a small farm growing certified organic specialty vegetable crops. Some of our most famous include our dry farmed tomatoes, strawberries, greens, various green beans, and fresh shelling beans. We sell to local restaurants and at Bay Area farmers markets, including- San Francisco Ferry Plaza on Saturdays, Berkely and Felton on Tuesdays, Santa Cruz on Wednesdays, and Santa Cruz on Sundays in the summer.

properties.name: Doug Arango's Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler 8826 MELROSE AVENUE, los angeles caWe can be reached at: Telephone: 310-278-3684 Fax: 310-278-3095 We are located at: 8826 Melrose Avenue West Hollywood, California 90069 (just west of Robertson Blvd. on the south side of the street) We are open: Monday through Saturday for dinner from 6:00pm and Monday through Friday for lunch 12:00 - 2:30pm Dining Bar: We offer full menu service at the Dining Bar during lunch and dinner where we accept walk-ins only. In addition to a full bar we offer over 500 selections from the win list and pour 18 wines by the glass, including three premium sakes. Call the restaurant directly for a calendar of "special events @ the bar." The wine list in the restaurant contains on average 500 selections. As vintages and selections change frequently, we have chosen to list below a summary of notable producers in the major wine growing areas represented on a regular basis. Many of the wineries listed below are also represented by multiple vineyard designations and multiple vintages, providing both depth and variety.

properties.name: Farallon Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler  450 Post St., san francisco caFarallon 450 Post Street San Francisco, CA Opened in 1997, Farallon is the acclaimed collaboration between Chef Mark Franz and restaurateur/designer Pat Kuleto. Located in San Francisco\'s popular Union Square area, Kuleto has designed a restaurant resembling a beautiful underwater fantasy that has proven to be the ideal setting for the sophisticated "coastal cuisine" created by Chef Franz.

properties.name: Faria Farms
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler   785 Travers Ln., watsonville, ca 95076We are a family farm nestled in the foothills of the Santa Cruz Mountains north of Watsonville, California. We have over 60 different varieties of apples. We have 15 varieties of pears, we have grapes, boysenberries, raspberries, black raspberries, and blackberries. We are in the proccess of planting ground cherries, bush beans, red, white, yellow, and blue potatoes, Armenian cucumbers, Lemon cucumbers, many varieties of peppers, passion fruit, and banana passion fruit. We have a few fig trees, apricot trees, peach trees, plums, quince, persimmons, chestnuts, walnuts, and almonds. Also there are free range chickens for meat and eggs. You can find our produce at the new Westside Farmers Market. Everything is grown naturally with no pestecides and irrigated with drip. 785 Travers Ln. Watsonville, CA 95076 Contact Information Brandon Faria 831-818-9327

properties.name: Farm 255 restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler   255 W. Washington Street, Athens, GA 30601From the Farm 255 website: "Farm 255 is a restaurant that seeks to reconnect food to its roots & people to their food. We serve local, seasonal, & sustainable food for supper nightly. In addition to the Farm we manage Full Moon Farms, a 7-acre organic/biodynamic farm in Athens. Unlike the owners of any other restaurant we know of, we are the folks sowing turnip seeds in the morning and cooking turnip greens in the evening. We supplement our harvests with those of other local family farmers and ranchers that avoid harmful chemicals and practice sustainable agriculture. Our menu, based on seasonal shifts in the field, changes as often as the weather. Our meat comes from pasture-raised animals & is hormone & antibiotic free. We purchase whole animals & use all the various cuts of meat throughout our menu. "We are as committed to good community as we are to our cuisine. We have an open kitchen so that dinner is a dialogue, where the farmer-chefs and diner-neighbors can have a meaningful exchange; we offer live music every night in honor of its legacy in this town; and we designed our restaurant with an eye toward the history of the 1930’s building that houses it. For us here at the Farm, eating is a celebration of food’s origins, the paths it travels on the way to our tables, and the lessons learned through the journey." I added them here because they are participating in an Outstanding in the Field farm dinner on September 10, 2006, in Athens, Georgia.

properties.name: Felton Certified Farmers' Market
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler   The mission of the Felton Certified Farmers\' Market is to provide a community marketplace offering fresh seasonal produce sold by those who grow it; to offer a variety of nonagricultural products; and to create a lively, educational and informative meeting place for the entire San Lorenzo Valley. The market is established for the benefit of both producers and consumers. It provides producers with direct market outlets at which they can sell at prices primarily higher than wholesale, and consumers with an opportunity to buy fresher food at prices normally lower than retail. We carry a wonderful variety of prduce, plants, flowers, bread, deserts, fish, prepared foods and there\'s always fun to be had.Our Season begins on May 1st and closes on or about Nov 30th During our operating season, we are open during these hours:, Tue 2:30 PM - 6:30 PM On average there are 30 vendors at our market. , Products available at Felton Certified Farmers\' Market:, Dairy & Eggs, eggs, Flowers, dried flowers, edible flowers, fresh flowers, Fruits and Berries, apples, apricots, asian pears, avocados, blackberries, blueberries, boysenberries, cantaloupes, cherries, figs, grapes, kiwis, melons, nectarines, peaches, pears, persimmons, plums, raspberries, strawberries, watermelons, Grains, popcorn, Herbs, dried herbs, fresh herbs, Meat Fish & Fowl, other fish, seafood, Processed, baked goods, bread, dried fruits, Sprouts, sprouts, wheat grass, Transplants, Plants, Vegetables, artichoke, arugula, asparagus, beets, broccoli, brussels sprouts, burdock, cabbage, carrots, cauliflower, celeriac, celery, chiles, chinese greens, collards, cucumber, daikon, dry beans, edamame soybeans, eggplant, fava beans, garlic, green beans, green onions, hot peppers, kale, kohlrabi, leeks, lettuce, mushrooms, mustard greens, nettles, okra, onions, parsnips, peas, pole beans, potatoes, pumpkins, radish, ramps, rhubarb, rutabagas, salad greens, salad mix, shallots, shell beans, spinach, summer squash, sun chokes, s

properties.name: Fifth Floor Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler  12 Fourth St, San Francisco, CA, 94103415-348-1555 Highly regarded by many as the best San Francisco French restaurant, Fifth Floor Restaurant is quite literally on the fifth floor of Hotel Palomar, just a few blocks from the center of Union Square. Oozing with elegance, Fifth Floor\'s rich dining room is both hip and classic, a carefully-designed state of grace befitting this Union Square restaurant. Zebra-print carpeting sets off an urban ambiance, Frette linens envelop waiting tables, and handsome framed paintings adorn the lush walls, creating an atmosphere that is rivaled only by the food Fifth Floor serves.

properties.name: Fords Filling Station
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler 531 Culver Blvd. Los Angeles, CA 90232

properties.name: Foreign Cinema
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler  2534 Mission St, San Francisco, CA, 94110Foreign Cinema 415-648-7600 Open since 1999, Foreign Cinema restaurant has garnered local, national and international acclaim as a quintessentially San Francisco dining experience. We offer a daily changing California/Mediterranean-inspired menu in an industrial chic setting located in the heart of the bustling Mission district. Dinner is served nightly as well as weekend brunch both Saturday and Sunday. Foreign and independent films are screened in our covered outdoor courtyard. Seating is available indoors fireside as well as upstairs in our semi-private mezzanine overlooking the dining room. Guests may enjoy cocktails and our complete menu from the main bar or on the patio outside. Modernism West, an art gallery in collaboration with Martin Mueller and Modernism Inc, is open to the public most nights and is an ideal space for private dining. After dinner drinks with rotating DJ\'s completes the evening in our adjacent bar, Laszlo.

properties.name: Grasing's Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler 6th and Mission St., carmel ca Chef Kurt Grasing has developed a menu that reflects stylist simplicity by using ultrafresh ingredients gleaned from California’s coast and Central Valley. Dishes are displayed in modest fashion that belie the intense combination of textures and flavors. The award winning wine list consists of an eclectic variety of California wines at reasonable prices. When the sun is out, enjoy dinner outside on the pet friendly patio for a true Carmel experience. Hours: Lunch: 11:00am - 3:00pm daily Dinner: 5:00pm - 9:00pm daily Tel: (831) 624-6562 Fax: (831) 624-7431 Street Address: 6th St & Mission, Carmel CA Across from the Fire Station on 6th

properties.name: Greens Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler   Fort Mason Bldg A, San Francisco, CA, 94102Building A, Fort Mason Center San Francisco, CA 94123 415-771-6222 Greens Restaurant was a pioneer in establishing vegetarian cuisine in the United States. In the 60\'s and 70\'s, vegetarian restaurants were mostly small out-of-the way cafÃ©s. There was no high profile vegetarian restaurant in the United States. Greens changed that by raising the bar, by placing vegetarian cuisine on a level with other fine dining restaurants. We have been reviewed by food and design magazines from the time we opened. Today we are surprised if a good restaurant does NOT have vegetarian options. Greens helped pave the way for this acceptance.

properties.name: Hawthorne Lane
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler  22 Hawthorne St, San Francisco, CAHawthorne Lane 415-777-9779 22 Hawthorne Lane, San Francisco 94105 Hawthorne Lane offers diners modern California cuisine accompanied by warm and sophisticated service. Demonstrating that a classic is always in style, Hawthorne Lane proudly celebrates its 10th anniversary in 2005. Hawthorne Lane is located in San Francisco\'s bustling South of Market district, adjacent to the Moscone Convention Center and the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art. Our charming, two-story brick building with ivy covered walls was built in 1922 as headquarters for the San Francisco Newspaper Company.

properties.name: Hayes Street Grill
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler    324 Hayes Street, San Francisco, CA, 94102Hayes Street Grill 415-863-5545 Hayes Street Grill is a neo-traditional San Francisco fish house across the street from the Performing Arts Center--directly across from Davies Symphony Hall and a block from the Opera House.

properties.name: High Ground Organics (Two Small Farms)
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler  We are a small family farm based in Watsonville, specializing in organic vegetables and speciality cut flowers. About our Community Supported Agriculture Program: In Community Supported Agriculture (CSA), farmers sell fresh organic produce directly to families on a weekly basis. By suscribing to a CSA, you suppport a local farmer in growing vegetables and flowers in an environmentally responsible manner. In turn, you get to eat farm fresh organic produce, become more familiar with the local cycles and seasons of food production, and get to know your farmer personally. CSA pick-up spots: For a full listing of CSA drop off spots please visit www.mariquita.com/membership/deliveries.html This year we will be selling our goods at the following farmers markets: * Mountain View * Watsonville Products offered by High Ground Organics (Two Small Farms): Flowers * fresh flowers Fruits and Berries * strawberries Vegetables * beets * broccoli * brussels sprouts * carrots * cauliflower * garlic * onions * potatoes * radish * summer squash * turnips * winter squash * more

properties.name: Hoffman's
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler   1102 Pacific Avenue, Santa Cruz, CA, 95060Hoffman\'s 831-420-0135 June and Ed Hoffman, longtime Santa Cruz residents, returned to Santa Cruz in 2000 to set up an exciting new bakery café with a full service dining room serving breakfast, lunch and dinner, breads, tortes and pastries, many of which are French inspired. Both June and Ed are UCSC graduates, as is their son Adam, the dining room manager. Ed started his baking career over 25 years ago in downtown Santa Cruz at the Old Theatre Cafe, where he was an apprentice baker under the tutelage of Lorenz Rothbucher. He also worked with Ron Schmidt, Al Negri, and Jean Wopplehorst, all former owners of bakeries in downtown Santa Cruz. It was a “natural” for Ed to think of moving to downtown Santa Cruz when he sold his shop in Kirkland, Washington, where the Hoffmans enjoyed 16 years of great success, providing award-winning cakes and pastries and exceptional wedding cakes. Visit our wedding cake gallery: http://www.hoffmansbakery.com/gallery.htm

properties.name: Homeless Garden Project
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler 101 Washington Street, Santa Cruz, CA, 95060Homeless Garden Project (831)426-3609 ext 2#

properties.name: Incanto
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler  1550 Church Street, San Francisco, CA, 94131Incanto 415-641-4500 1550 Church Street, San Francisco Situated in the heart of one of San Francisco\'s most charming residential neighborhoods, Incanto\'s rustic Italian setting, with its handcrafted stone, antique brick and woodwork, 16th century Latin parchments, and private dining room dedicated to poet Dante Alighieri, provides a uniquely warm and inviting dining environment. Incanto\'s daily-changing menu honors old-world traditions including house-cured meats, unusual regional pastas, fresh local seafood and a commitment to sustainably grown and harvested produce. Incanto\'s award-winning wine program features one of the most diverse Italian wine lists in the United States and an ever-changing lineup of more than twenty wines by the glass, half-glass, half-liter, and flight.

properties.name: Jack's La Jolla
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler  7863 Girard Ave La Jolla, CA 92037Jack\'s La Jolla has changed the culinary face of San Diego. With its three distinctive restaurants ranging from casual to fine dining and its four unique bars, the three level complex, located in the Village of La Jolla, overlooks a center courtyard featuring a fire pit and fountain. The Dining Room at Jack\'s, recently voted one of San Diego\'s top seven restaurants by the Gayot Guide, is the showcase of executive chef Tony DiSalvo. Formerly chef de cuisine at New York\'s Jean Georges, one of the top twenty restaurants in the world and winner of three stars in the Michelin Guide, DiSalvo along with chef de cuisine Marco Ferraro have created a menu of innovative contemporary American cuisine. The restaurant\'s sophisticated ambiance, stellar service and thoughtful wine list, make it a top San Diego dining destination. Hours of Operation: Nightly 5:30pm - 10:00pm Jack’s Grille, Located on the first level, the Grille takes advantage of the open air atrium. The menu is casual featuring pizzas, pastas, salads and sandwiches all presented with the thoughtful, artistic flair of executive chef Tony DiSalvo and his crew. Hours of Operation: Daily 11:30am - 2:00am The Wine Bar features a piano bar, an extensive wine list, and a large number of rotating wines by the glass are available daily. Hours of Operation: Daily 11:30am - 2:00am The Wall Street Bar is located between the Dining Room at Jack\'s and offers a quiet spot for a drink before dinner or just a place to relax. A variety of late night dance music makes it a perfect place of San Diego\'s sophisticated young professionals. Hours of Operation: Nightly 5:30pm to 2:00am Ocean View Room and Bar features views of La Jolla Cove and offer diners a sushi bar and grilled seafood and steaks. Open for lunch and dinner, the third floor is all San Diego: fresh seafood, outside dining and ocean views. The Beach Bar, which fronts on Girard, epitomizes fun. Guests can enjoy retro cocktails, seasonal drinks and the Ocean View Room menu. With steel drums playing in the background, the Beach Bar is La Jolla’s tiny spot in paradise. Hours of Operation: Daily 11:30am - 5pm | Thursday - Saturday open until 2:00am Jack’s Sidewalk Café welcomes guests throughout the day with freshly brewed coffees and teas, Italian sodas and smoothies. Pizza, Pasta, Panini, and salads plus a full range of pastries and cookies are available daily. Hours of Operation: Sunday - Tuesday 8:00am - 8:00pm | Wednesday, Thursday 8:00am -10:00pm | Friday, Saturday 8:00am - 11:00pm

properties.name: Jacob's Farm / Del Cabo
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler http://local.google.com/local?f=q&sll=37.006939,-122.043686&sspn=0.250586,0.414047&hl=en&q=farm,95060&latlng=36982946,-122043612,2653263545090252124Located on the California coast, forty-fives miles south of San Francisco, JACOBS FARM grows a complete line of culinary herbs (including hard to find exotic herbs), English peas, sugar snap peas, arugula, red beets, edible flowers, fava beans, and olallieberries. Founded in 1980 as an ORGANIC specialty farm, Jacobs Farm has grown to 200 cultivated acres. In 1985 we founded Del Cabo, a project in Baja California established to assist small growers by teaching organic growing practices, management and organizational skills and connecting them to markets in the USA, Canada, Europe, and Asia. Our Del Cabo line includes a year round supply of basil and specialty cherry tomatoes. Our commitment to organic farming is rooted in our belief that the use of chemical fertilizers and toxic pest control materials are detrimental to our health and the health of our planet. Healthy soil is the cornerstone of organic farming while chemical inputs destroy organisms needed to build a healthy soil. A healthy soil is critical to producing healthy plants and a healthy environment.

properties.name: Jardiniere
properties.description: Posted by Transfairusa   300 Grove St., San Francisco, CA, United Statesfair trade

properties.name: Kokkari Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler   200 Jackson Street, San Francisco, CA, 94111Kokkari Restaurant 415-981-0983 Kokkari (pronounced Ko-kar-ee) is a small fishing village located on the island of Samos in the Aegean Sea, whose name is derived from the small onions that were once produced in nearby fields. Its fertile soil and Mediterranean climate translated into an abundance of fresh produce as well as treasured seafood and game. Legend tells that Kokkari is the site where Orion, a mighty hunter and a young man of gigantic stature and great beauty, fell in love with the daughter of the King of Chios. For the love of her, Orion foraged the island for wild game and seafood to prepare elaborate banquets in celebration of their love. Today we hope you will enjoy your own celebration as you dine at Kokkari Estiatorio on food "fit for the Gods" prepared with an Aegean palate and the style of innovative California fare.

properties.name: Kuumbwa Jazz Center
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler 320 Cedar St., Santa Cruz CA 95060 World-class jazz center presenting quality music and dinner in an intimate setting. 320-2 Cedar St • Santa Cruz, CA, 95060 Contact: Julie Rix, production/facility manager Phone: 831.427.2227 The blending of the culinary arts and the art of jazz seems to be the perfect recipe for enjoying a creative evening. The renowned Kuumbwa Jazz Center is a nonprofit organization that has been presenting world-class jazz since 1975. Each Monday night we present internationally known jazz artists and serve dinner prepared by our chef Cheryl Simons. Cheryl cooks with the freshest local ingredients, sometimes from her own organic garden. Her meals are always a delicious compliment to the shows. Thursday nights are the “Cookin’ at the Kuumbwa” series where we feature great music from local and regional musicians along with specially prepared dinners...and they are one of the best deals in town! Cookin’ at the Kuumbwa features: “Guest Chefs” from some of the finest local restaurants; “Closet Chefs” whose talents are established elsewhere, but we have faith you’re going to like what they serve, along with Café Kuumbwa resident chef Cheryl Simons. We also offer select local wines and beers.

properties.name: LA Bruschetta Ristorante
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler 5447 Highway 9, Felton, CA, 95018LA Bruschetta Ristorante 831-335-3337 5447 Highway 9 Felton, CA 95018 LA BRUSCHETTA\'s goal is to serve a unique combination of Old World and modern Sicilian cuisine in a relaxed atmosphere with fine service. LA BRUSCHETTA strives to provide the highest quality using organic products whenever possible, fresh ingredients, and homemade dishes. LA BRUSCHETTA offers an extensive selection of imported and domestic wines to savor with your meal, as well as rich cappuccino coffees to accompany your homemade tiramisu or gelati. Pleasant summer dining on its flower strewn garden patio under an ancient oak with redwoods towering in the background and elegant year-round indoor dining are offered at LA BRUSCHETTA. The talented Rubino Familia\'s beautiful stained glass pieces and paintings adorn the restaurant, along with typical Sicilian crafts. Chef Luca Rubino & Familia invite you to visit their popular Felton restaurant, where Santa Cruz County\'s most delicious Sicilian cuisine is artfully prepared for your delight with local produce from the Santa Cruz mountains.

properties.name: Le Petit Robert
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler  2300 Polk Street, San Francisco, CA, 94109Le Petit Robert 415-922-8100 2300 Polk Street San Francisco CA 94109 Le Petit Robert is a sophisticated neighborhood bistro in the heart of San Francisco\'s Russian Hill. The restaurant, located on upper Polk Street , is an area, which is fast becoming known as "little France". With French antique stores, boutiques and Le Petit Robert\'s sister bakery/cafÃ© , La Boulange de Polk, next door, this is a wonderful neighborhood to walk, shop, enjoy a full meal or sit and relax with an expresso or a glass of wine. Under the direction of Chef and Owner Robert Cubberly, Le Petit Robert serves authentic French bistro fare with an emphasis on fresh ingredients acquired from some of California\'s best produce farms and artisanal purveyors. Robert\'s menu, which changes seasonally, is enjoyed with a number of reasonably priced wines from both the old and new worlds. Most selections are available by the glass or carafe.

Our CSA runs March to Thanksgiving; We attend the Saturday farmer\'s market on the Embarcadero every Saturday year-round. We run our CSA with High Ground Organics and call our joint effort "Two Small Farms." Call Zelda for more information 831.786.0625

properties.name: Old Monterey Farmers' Market
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler     Downtown is the home of the Old Monterey Market Place, which is held on Alvarado, the city\'s historic main street, every Tuesday afternoon, rain or shine. A Certified Farmers\' Market, a deliciously tempting Baker\'s Alley and dozens of unique craft vendors are the main draw of this extremely popular event, wich typically attracts more thatn 12,000 shoppers and strollers each week and is the largest weekly gathering in Monterey County. Now in its 11th year, the Market Place is known for maintaining its fun and festive atmosphere all year-round. Entertainment ranges from clowns to face painters for young visitors, to singers and musicians for the young at heart. Our Season begins on and closes on or about During our operating season, we are open during these hours: * Tue 4:00 PM - 8:00 PM Products available at Old Monterey Farmers\' Market: Dairy & Eggs * butter * eggs * goat cheese * milk * yogurt Flowers * dried flowers * edible flowers * fresh flowers Fruits and Berries * apples * apricots * asian pears * avocados * blackberries * blueberries * boysenberries * cantaloupes * cherries * figs * grapes * kiwis * melons * nectarines * peaches * pears * persimmons * plums * raspberries * strawberries * watermelons Grains * amaranth * barley * buckwheat * grain corn * grain soy beans * millet * oats * popcorn * rice * rye * spelt * wheat * wild rice Herbs * dried herbs * fresh herbs * medicinal herbs Meat Fish & Fowl * beef * chicken * other fish * seafood * trout * turkey Nuts & Seeds * chestnuts * flax * hazelnuts * peanuts * pecans * sunflower seeds * walnuts Processed * baked goods * bread * dried fruits * honey * jam or preserves * maple candy Sprouts * sprouts * wheat grass Transplants * Plants Vegetables * artichoke * arugula * asparagus * beets * broccoli * brussels sprouts * burdock * cabbage * carrots * cauliflower * celeriac * celery * chiles * chinese greens * collards * cucumber * daikon * dry beans * edamame soybeans * eggplant * fava beans * g

properties.name: Piatti Ristorante Bar
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler 3905 Rivermark Plaza, Santa Clara, CA, 95054Piatti Ristorante Bar Mon - Thu: 11am - 9:30pm Fri: 11am - 10pm Sat: 5pm - 10pm Sun: 5pm - 9pm Patio dining • Banquet facilities • Reservations are recommended • Full bar Ample free parking • Wheelchair accessible • Private and semi-private dining 3905 RIVERMARK PLAZA SANTA CLARA, CA. 95054 PH: 408-330-9212 FAX: 408-330-9252 A casual and comfortable dining environment utilizing rustic materials such as reclaimed wooden timbers, wide plank flooring and hints of color from glazed tiles. The outside courtyard provides a wonderful setting for dining under the stars and olive trees next to a sparkling fountain and cozy fire pit.

properties.name: Pilar
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler 807 Main Street, Napa, CA, 94559Pilar 707-252-4474 Located at 807 Main Street, near the new Third Street bridge and an integral part of the new Napa Waterfront District, Pilar is a major contribution to the renaissance of historic downtown Napa. The 49-seat restaurant is an oasis of cool re-straint to highlight the "contemporary Napa Valley" menu created by the husband and wife pair. Celery green walls are complimented by slate blue concrete floors and bar countertop. Galvanized steel details the bar front and a long black leather banquette anchors the opposite side of the restaurant. The antique-pecan finish on the high-backed, handcrafted chairs provides the backdrop for the jewel-tone highlights of the black upholstery. In addition to the beer and wine available at the bar, dining is also an option at one of the six barstools. Dinner: Tuesday - Saturday, 5:30p to 9:00p Lunch: Tuesday - Saturday, 11:30p to 2:30p

We are open Monday through Friday from 5 to 10 pm, and Saturdays and Sundays from 12 noon to 10 pm. Our phone number is: 415-945-8900. We are located at: 320 Magnolia Ave. Larkspur, California 94939

properties.name: River Cafe & Cheese Shop
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler    415 River Street, Santa Cruz, CA, 95060River Cafe & Cheese Shop 831-420-1280 415 River Street, Santa Cruz, CA 95060 Located just one block from the Highway 1/Highway 9 intersection in Santa Cruz, the River Cafe and Cheese Shop is the perfect place for a gourmet lunch--or to grab some picnic supplies before you visit the wineries of Santa Cruz county. Best of all, you can taste the cheeses!

properties.name: Rose Pistola
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler 532 Columbus Avenue, San Francisco, CA, 94133Rose Pistola 415-399-8758 Rose Pistola is a celebration of the bawdy, friendly, but sophisticated side of San Francisco\'s Italian quarterâ€”North Beach. This stylish gathering place personifies the vibrancy of its namesake, a North Beach denizen who ran the most colorful bar and restaurant in the neighborhood. With its San Francisco-style dining counter, booths, cozy dining room and lively bar, Rose Pistola invites everything from a leisurely glass of Chianti and a bowl of pasta, to a traditional, Italian-style feast of seasonal antipasti, whole roasted fish and rotisserie meats.

properties.name: Sestri Restaurant & Bar
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler 655 Capitola Road Suite 102, Santa Cruz, CA, 95062Sestri Restaurant & Bar 831-479-0200 Check out the Good Times Best of 2005! Thank you Santa Cruz for voting us: Best New Restaurant Best Restaurant in Santa Cruz Restaurant of the Year, Santa Cruz County We buy from local vineyards, organic farms and fisheries. Welcome to Sestri, where rustic cooking blends Old World elegance, Santa Cruz local seafood and vegetables, and imaginative Italian flavors. Sestri earned its name from Santa CruzÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Sister City in Italy, Sestri Levante. Specialties include wood-fired oven and rotisserie meats and pizzas, house-made meatballs and pastas. Sestri\'s wine list highlights wines from Santa Cruz area vintners, as well as from select Italian wine regions. The restaurant has a full bar, three gorgeous dining rooms, patio seating, and private dining facilities. Vibrant acrylic paintings by Suzanne Etienne and Nicole Etienne create an atmosphere of elegance, making Sestri the perfect place for a romantic dinner or a gathering of old friends. Join us for a unique and elegant dining experience at a neighborhood restaurant price.

properties.name: TLC Ranch
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler  410 Hall Rd., watsonville, ca 95076Location 410 Hall Rd. Watsonville, CA 95076 Contact Information Jim Dunlop 1-209-505-4558 We are a family operation, raising Cornish meat chickens, 650 laying hens (a mix of Barred Rock, Black Austrolorp, and New Hampshire Reds) for large, brown eggs, and a mix of heritage (Tamworth) and conventional breeds of pig. All of our animals are raised on certified organic pasture in movable pens, recieving fresh grass & weeds daily as we rotate them around 5 acres. All of our feed is 100% certified organic. Additionally, we will raise a limited number of heritage breed turkeys for Thanksgiving. Buy TLC Ranch meat and eggs and get your mouth around the best tasting, healthiest, and most environmentally sound animal products around...

properties.name: The Slanted Door
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler  1 Ferry Bldg, San Francisco, CA, 94111The Slanted Door 415-861-8032 The Slanted Door is a modern Vietnamese restaurant that showcases the abundance of produce as well as ecologically farmed meat, game and poultry found at small farms around the San Francisco Bay Area. The Phan family opened the original Slanted Door in 1995 with a vision to blend Vietnamese cooking technique with local ingredients. The new restaurant takes this vision even further in its new environment, designed by Olle Lundberg, overlooking the San Francisco Bay. The food, relaxed atmosphere, riesling-driven wine list, full bar with premium brands and fresh squeezed juices, and hard-to-find Chinese teas all speak to the restaurant\'s originality and commitment to quality. Our to-go store called "Out the Door" is now open in the main hall of the Ferry Building, around the corner from the restaurant. Out the Door offers prepared dishes as well as easy-to-use cooking kits that give you the opportunity to make our dishes at home.

properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler 4616 Soquel Drive, Soquel, CA, 95073Tortilla Flats 831-476-1754 4616 Soquel Dr. Soquel, CA 95073 Light, flavorful, mexican fare. Chef Cheryl Marquez has developed a loyal following over the 25 years she has owned Tortilla Flats. A Canadian of French extraction, she learned to love Mexican fare while working in New Orleans. She focuses on freshness and uses organic, locally grown ingredients where possible.

properties.name: UCSC Farm & Garden
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler95064The Center for Agroecology & Sustainable Food Systems is a research, education, and public service program at the University of California, Santa Cruz, dedicated to increasing ecological sustainability and social justice in the food and agriculture system. On the UCSC campus, the Center operates the 2-acre Alan Chadwick Garden and the 25-acre Farm. Both sites are managed using organic production methods and serve as research, teaching, and training facilities for students, staff, and faculty.

properties.name: UCSC Farm and Garden Project
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler   1156 High St., santa cruz, california 95064The UCSC Farm & Garden are operated by staff and students of the Center for Agroecology & Sustainable Food Systems at UC Santa Cruz. The Farm & Garden serve as training sites for students in the six-month Apprenticeship in Ecological Horticulture, who raise a wide variety of vegetable, fruit, and flower crops as part of their hands-on training. Fresh organic produce is sold twice a week through a 90-member CSA and the market cart, located at the base of campus.

properties.name: Zuni Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler  1658 Market St, San Francisco, CAZuni Cafe 415-552-2522 This James Beard Award winning restaurant with a clientele as diverse as San Francisco opened in 1979. A vibrant Parisian-style standing-only copper bar greets you as you enter on Rose Alley. Zuniâ€™s menu changes daily with dishes inspired by traditional Italian and French recipes. Nearly all of the produce, meat, and fish served at Zuni is farmed and harvested in a sustainable manner. Even without a reservation, bar tables are available on a first come, first served basis and the full menu is available. The bar also serves traditional cocktails made with top-shelf ingredients; refreshments at its best in an environment of effortless hospitality. Whether you dine early or prefer to dine after theater, Zuni is a welcoming haven.

properties.name: cesar
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler 1515 Shattuck Avenue, BERKELEY, CA, 94709-1516César presents a unique combination of Spanish food, a French name, American restaurateurs, and a global, award-winning selection of wines and spirits. Founded in 1998 by three Chez Panisse alumni – Richard Mazzera, Dennis Lapuyade, and Stephen Singer – César is essentially a Mediterranean-style bar/restaurant that serves a delicious and diverse selection of Spanish tapas, or small plates. Our original location on Shattuck Avenue sits in the heart of what has affectionately become known as the “Gourmet Ghetto” in North Berkeley, right next door to Chez Panisse, the restaurant generally recognized as the genesis of what has come to be known as California cuisine.
